creator: picaune@hotmail.com
text:
The following is stated in the Apache Windows documentation
(http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/platform/win_service.html) :

You can install Apache as a Windows NT service as follows:
    apache -i -n "service name"

When attempted, this results in the following error menssage:
C:\PROGRA~1\APACHE~1\Apache2\bin>apache -i -n "ApachePENP" -f conf/httpd.penp.conf
apache: illegal option -- i
Usage: apache [-D name] [-d directory] [-f file]
              [-C "directive"] [-c "directive"]
              [-w] [-k start|restart|stop|shutdown]
              [-k install|config|uninstall] [-n service_name]
              [-v] [-V] [-h] [-l] [-L] [-t]
Options:
  -D name           : define a name for use in <IfDefine name> directives
[...]
C:\PROGRA~1\APACHE~1\Apache2\bin>

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
-u/-i were deprecated long ago.  Sorry our docs are out of date... this will
  serve as my reminder to get the win_service.html in sync.

The windows documentation was rewritten a while ago and it's fixed now.

Thanks for using Apache!
